Description: Fragment of floor of North Ionian pottery plate or shallow bowl. On slipped interior, between bands with added red and white lines, metopal band of alternating rosette-stars and solid squares; central motif of lotus buds with volutes, bounded by ring of dots. Exterior reserved with three red-brown bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 226, no. 127)
Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 114, pl. XXXV, no. 324.10)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.1123)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5978 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
